bathroom.question: How long does a bathroom installation take?
bathroom.answer: A typical bathroom installation takes 1-3 weeks depending on the complexity. This includes plumbing, tiling, fitting fixtures, and final touches. Simple bathroom suites may take 5-7 days, while full renovations with structural changes can take up to 4 weeks.

bathroom.question: How much does a new bathroom cost in the UK?
bathroom.answer: Bathroom installation costs range from £3,000 for a basic suite to £8,000+ for a premium bathroom with high-end fixtures and extensive tiling. Costs include labor, materials, plumbing, electrical work, and waste removal.

bathroom.question: Do I need planning permission for a bathroom?
bathroom.answer: Most bathroom installations don't require planning permission, but you may need Building Regulations approval for structural changes, new drainage, or ventilation. Your bathroom installer will advise on requirements.

bathroom.question: Are bathroom installers vetted?
bathroom.answer: Yes, all bathroom fitters on TradeMatch are ID verified, insurance checked, and reviewed by previous customers. We ensure all tradespeople meet our quality standards.

bathroom.question: Can I get same-day bathroom quotes?
bathroom.answer: Yes, simply enter your postcode and requirements, and you'll receive quotes from local bathroom installers within 24 hours. Most customers receive 3-5 quotes to compare.

kitchen.question: How long does kitchen fitting take?
kitchen.answer: Kitchen installation typically takes 2-4 weeks including removal of old units, fitting new units, worktops, appliances, and connecting plumbing and electrics. The timeline depends on kitchen size and complexity.

kitchen.question: What's included in kitchen fitting costs?
kitchen.answer: Kitchen fitting costs include removal of old units, installation of new cabinets, worktops, sinks, appliances, and connecting plumbing and electrics. Additional costs may include flooring, tiling, and decorating.

kitchen.question: Do I need to hire separate trades for kitchen fitting?
kitchen.answer: No, experienced kitchen fitters can handle all aspects including carpentry, plumbing, and basic electrical work. However, specialist plumbers and electricians may be needed for complex installations.

kitchen.question: How much does a new kitchen cost?
kitchen.answer: New kitchen costs range from £5,000 for a basic kitchen to £15,000+ for a high-end fitted kitchen with premium appliances. Mid-range kitchens typically cost £8,000-£12,000.

kitchen.question: Are kitchen fitters insured?
kitchen.answer: Yes, all kitchen fitters on TradeMatch carry public liability insurance and are fully vetted before joining our platform. This protects you and your property during installation.

loft.question: Do I need planning permission for a loft conversion?
loft.answer: Many loft conversions fall under Permitted Development Rights and don't require planning permission. However, this depends on property type, roof alterations, and conservation area restrictions. Building Regulations approval is always required.

loft.question: How long does a loft conversion take?
loft.answer: Most loft conversions take 6-10 weeks depending on complexity. This includes structural work, insulation, electrics, plumbing, plastering, and final fit-out.

loft.question: Will a loft conversion add value to my property?
loft.answer: Yes, a high-quality loft conversion can increase property value by up to 20-25%. The exact value increase depends on location, quality of work, and local property market.

loft.question: Is my loft suitable for conversion?
loft.answer: Most lofts are suitable if they have sufficient head height (usually 2.2m minimum) and adequate roof structure. A professional survey will confirm suitability and identify any structural requirements.

loft.question: How much does a loft conversion cost?
loft.answer: Loft conversion costs vary: Velux conversions £25,000-£35,000, Dormer conversions £40,000-£55,000, Hip to gable £45,000-£60,000, and Mansard conversions £55,000-£75,000+.
